title: cargo install cargo-outdated AND cargo install cargo-tree fails on Windows 10
body:
Running `cargo install cargo-outdated` and `cargo install cargo-tree` on Windows 10 fails with the following message:

```
error: failed to run custom build command for `libssh2-sys v0.2.10`
process didn't exit successfully: `C:\Users\Kasper\AppData\Local\Temp\cargo-installIkYK45\release\build\libssh2-sys-48e25dbaa02eea1c\build-script-build` (exit code: 101)
--- stdout
running: "cmake" "C:\\Users\\Kasper\\.cargo\\registry\\src\\github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823\\libssh2-sys-0.2.10\\libssh2" "-G" "Visual Studio 15 2017 Win64" "-DCRYPTO_BACKEND=WinCNG" "-DENABLE_ZLIB_COMPRESSION=OFF" "-DBUILD_SHARED_LIBS=OFF" "-DCMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR=lib" "-DBUILD_EXAMPLES=OFF" "-DBUILD_TESTING=OFF" "-DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=C:\\Users\\Kasper\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\cargo-installIkYK45\\release\\build\\libssh2-sys-d82c40a98cec7a75\\out" "-DCMAKE_C_FLAGS= /nologo /MD" "-DCMAKE_C_FLAGS_RELEASE= /nologo /MD" "-DCMAKE_CXX_FLAGS= /nologo /MD" "-DCMAKE_CXX_FLAGS_RELEASE= /nologo /MD" "-DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release"

--- stderr
fatal: Not a git repository (or any of the parent directories): .git
thread 'main' panicked at '
failed to execute command: The system can not find the specified file. (os error 2)
is `cmake` not installed?

build script failed, must exit now', C:\Users\Kasper\.cargo\registry\src\github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823\cmake-0.1.33\src\lib.rs:773:5
note: Run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace.

warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
```
